trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Sorting"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Sorting> event when a Sort button (a button with its `CommandName` property set to "Sort") is clicked, but before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control handles the sort operation.
This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine, such as canceling the sorting operation, whenever this event occurs.

Although any button within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control with its `CommandName` property set to "Sort" will raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Sorting> event, Sort buttons typically appear in the header row of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs> object is passed to the event-handling method, which allows you to specify or determine the sort expression and sort direction in which to sort the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
To determine the sort expression, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs.SortExpression%2A> property.
To determine the sort direction, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs.SortDirection%2A> property.
You can also cancel a sorting operation by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSelectEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs> class.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs>.
Property
Initial value
The value of the `sortDirection` parameter.
The value of the `sortExpression` parameter.
This constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
The sort expression used to sort the items in the control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SortDirection"></xref> that indicates the direction in which to sort the items in the control.
Gets or sets the direction in which to sort the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Sorting> event is raised, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs.SortDirection%2A> property to determine the order in which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control will sort its items (based on the sort expression) when the sort operation is performed.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Sorting> event occurs before the sort operation, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs.SortDirection%2A> property to programmatically set the sort direction.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SortDirection"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the expression used to sort the items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Sorting> event is raised, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewSortEventArgs.SortExpression%2A> property to determine the sort expression that will be used to sort the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control when sort operation is performed.
By default, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control sorts a single column at a time.
The sort expression simply contains the name of the field to sort.
You can also sort multiple columns at a time by programmatically setting this property to a comma-separated list of field names.
The expression used to sort the items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
